joxy.utils

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • joxy.utils.Utils

  • public class Utils
extends Object
    A general class providing basic utilities for the Joxy Look and Feel.

    Note: this should become kind-of the public API for application developers wishing to improve their application's LAF when using Joxy. But at the moment it contains primarily internals...

    Author:
    Thom Castermans, Willem Sonke

    • Field Detail

      • MENU_HIGHLIGHT_DARK

        public static final String MENU_HIGHLIGHT_DARK
        This value is used for the key [Style]MenuHighlightMode to denote a dark highlightcolour should be used. Note that if a user has selected this (or, did not alter the default value) then there will be no key in the KDE configuration files. This key is then set by default by this class however.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MENU_HIGHLIGHT_SUBTLE

        public static final String MENU_HIGHLIGHT_SUBTLE
        The value used in the KDE configuration files to describe a subtle highlight should be used for highlighting of menuitems. This value is used for the key [Style]MenuHighlightMode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MENU_HIGHLIGHT_STRONG

        public static final String MENU_HIGHLIGHT_STRONG
        The value used in the KDE configuration files to describe a strong highlight should be used for highlighting of menuitems. This value is used for the key [Style]MenuHighlightMode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • useRNDColorScheme

        public static boolean useRNDColorScheme
        Indicates if the RND color scheme should be used

        public Utils()

    • Method Detail

      • concatArrays

        public static <T> T[] concatArrays(T[] first,
                   T[] second)
        Concatenate two arrays and return the result. This method is copied from StackOverflow, answer of Joachim Sauer and then slightly adjusted.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of both arrays.
        Parameters:
        first - The first array.
        second - The second array.
        Returns:
        An array consisting of the concatenation of first and second. That is, 
        \forall i : 0 <= i < first.length : \result[i] == first[i]
        and analoguous 
        \forall i : first.length <= i < \result.length : \result[i] == second[i - first.length]
        .
        If one the two is null, the other array will be returned. If both are null, then null will be returned.

      • isKDE

        public static boolean isKDE()
        Returns true if the window manager used on the machine the program is running on is KDE. This is determined by checking if the environment variable KDE_FULL_SESSION is set. When !Utils.isLinux(), this method always returns false and does not even try to do another check.
        Returns:
        True if the window manager in use is KDE, false otherwise.

      • isLinux

        public static boolean isLinux()
        Returns true if the OS the program is running on is Linux.
        Returns:
        True if OS.name equals Linux, false otherwise.

      • getKDEColorMap

        public static Object[] getKDEColorMap()
        Returns an array of key/value pairs that indicate some system colors as set by the user in his/her KDE color theme. If !Utils.isKDE() (this can happen when the color theme cannot be found too), a default set of colors is returned. This default colormap is the default KDE color theme.
        Returns:
        Array of key/value pairs to be used in for example UIDefaults.putDefaults(). This method will always return a valid array of key/value pairs.

      • getKDEPropertiesMap

        public static Object[] getKDEPropertiesMap()
        Returns an array of key/value pairs that indicate some properties as set by the user in his/her KDE settings, for example font. If !Utils.isKDE() (this can happen when the config file cannot be found too), a default set of properties is returned. This default propertiesmap is the set of default KDE properties.
        Returns:
        Array of key/value pairs to be used in for example UIDefaults.putDefaults(). This method will always return a valid array of key/value pairs.

      • getKDEIconsMap

        public static Object[] getKDEIconsMap()
        Returns an array of key/value pairs that indicate some KDE icons.
        Returns:
        Array of key/value pairs with icons.

      • getOxygenIcon

        public static ImageIcon getOxygenIcon(String name,
                      int size)
        Gets an icon from the Oxygen theme from the /usr/share/icons/oxygen folder. Issues a warning and returns null if the icon cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the icon, without extension; for example actions/go-previous.
        size - The size of the icon you want. Note that this is given as an integer only because all icons are squared. For example, giving '32' as parameter will cause this method to look for a '32x32' size icon.
        Returns:
        The created ImageIcon.

      • displayNotification

        public static void displayNotification(String title,
                       String text,
                       TrayIcon.MessageType type)
        Displays a notification by using the notify-send program.
        Parameters:
        title - The title. KDE programs usually put their title in this field.
        text - The text to put in the notification.
        type - The type of notification as a MessageType.

      • isJoxyActive

        public static boolean isJoxyActive()
        Returns whether Joxy is the current look and feel.
        Returns:
        Whether Joxy is the look and feel.
